title: General Knowledge Challenge
description: A fun quiz to test your knowledge on a variety of topics!

questions.questionText: What is the capital city of Australia?
questions.explanation: While Sydney is the largest city, Canberra has been the capital of Australia since 1927.

questions.questionText: Which planet is known as the 'Red Planet'?
questions.explanation: Mars is often called the 'Red Planet' because of the iron oxide prevalent on its surface, which gives it a reddish appearance.

questions.questionText: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest of the world's five oceans, covering more than 30% of the Earth's surface.

questions.questionText: Who wrote the famous play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.explanation: William Shakespeare, the famous English playwright, wrote the tragic romance of 'Romeo and Juliet'.

questions.questionText: What is the chemical symbol for Gold?
questions.explanation: The symbol 'Au' for gold comes from its Latin name, 'aurum'.

questions.questionText: In which country would you find the ancient city of Petra?
questions.explanation: The famous archaeological site of Petra, known for its rock-cut architecture, is located in southern Jordan.
